definition: Pausing after questions to allow thinking time, improving response quality and participation

positive_examples: I'll give you a moment to think before you answer.
Take your time - there's no rush to respond.
Pausing for 5-10 seconds after a question improves the quality of answers.
Silence after a question is productive thinking time, not awkward dead air.
negative_examples: Come on, hurry up with your answer.
Anyone? Anyone? Okay, the answer is...
If you don't know, just say so and we'll move on.
training_hints.disambiguation: Intentional pause for thinking, not rushing
